content.description:
From a high stand start on two good edges, climb up and right to the center jug. Gather your wits so you don't have to do the crux again, and have your buddy rearrange the pads for the topout.  

 Go up and slightly right to a good right-hand sidepull to slap over the bulge. This keeps you in a decent landing zone.  The top bulge is harder than it looks, but not hard.
content.location: At the lower left end of the skull boulder, are some horizontal features that resemble the face of a large creature with its eyes closed.  The starting holds are on the lips of this creature.

content.description: Start on Northwest arete as low as you'd like to brave the choss, then make long pulls up and leftward on good holds of increasing rock quality. Might be easier, but totally worth doing
content.location: Opposite corner of boulder from Resting In Peace, accessing this requires some interesting scrambling either across slabs under the South end of the Skull boulder, or (easier) around the North side below the Crossbones boulder to drop into a little alcove. Landing is angled and a little gravelly, but not unsafe.

content.description:
Once toproped, but not too tall to boulder by modern standards...if you have enough pads.

 Tall...
